column2: A methodology for obtaining concept graphs from word graphs
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=0 single-column centered left-indent right-indent font-largest page-top headchar-capital above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Marcos Calvo, Jon Ander Gómez, Lluı́s-F. Hurtado, Emilio Sanchis
column3: page=0 xpos=1 ypos=0 single-column centered left-indent right-indent font-largest indented-line shorter-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: Departament de Sistemes Informàtics i Computació
column3: page=0 xpos=2 ypos=0 single-column centered left-indent right-indent font-larger indented-line shorter-tail headchar-capital

column2: Universitat Politècnica de València
column3: page=0 xpos=3 ypos=1 single-column centered left-indent right-indent font-larger indented-line shorter-tail headchar-capital

column2: Camı́ de Vera s/n, 46022, València, Spain
column3: page=0 xpos=2 ypos=1 single-column centered left-indent right-indent font-larger hanged-line longer-tail headchar-capital above-line-space

column2: {mcalvo,jon,lhurtado,esanchis}@dsic.upv.es
column3: page=0 xpos=1 ypos=1 single-column centered left-indent right-indent font-largest hanged-line longer-tail line-space symbol-atmark column-bottom above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Abstract
column3: page=0 xpos=1 ypos=2 left-column centered left-indent right-indent font-largest column-top line-blank-line line-double-space line-space string-abstract headchar-capital above-double-space above-line-space

column2: In this work, we describe a methodology
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column centered left-indent right-indent font-smallest hanged-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: based on the Stochastic Finite State Trans-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent font-smallest aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ducers paradigm for Spoken Language Under-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent font-smallest aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: standing (SLU) for obtaining concept graphs
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent font-smallest aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: from word graphs. In the edges of these con-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent font-smallest aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: cept graphs, both semantic and lexical infor-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent font-smallest aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: mation are represented. This makes these
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent font-smallest aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: graphs a very useful representation of the in-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column centered left-indent right-indent font-smallest aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: formation for SLU. The best path in these con-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column centered left-indent right-indent font-smallest aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: cept graphs provides the best sequence of con-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column centered left-indent right-indent font-smallest aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: cepts.
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column left-indent right-indent font-smallest aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 1 Introduction
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column right-indent font-largest hanged-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: The task of SLU can be seen as the process that,
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-comma

column2: given an utterance, computes a semantic interpreta-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion of the information contained in it. This semantic
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: interpretation will be based on a task-dependent set
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: of concepts.
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: An area where SLU systems are typically applied
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: is the construction of spoken dialog systems. The
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: goal of the SLU subsystem in the context of a dia-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: log system is to process the information given by the
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR) module, and
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: provide the semantic interpretation of it to the Dia-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: log Manager, which will determine the next action
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: of the dialog. Thus, the work of the SLU module
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: can be split into two subtasks, the first of them is
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the identification of the sequence of concepts and the
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: segments of the original sentence according to them,
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: and the other is the extraction of the relevant infor-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: mation underlying to these labeled segments. In this
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: work we will focus on concept labeling, but we will
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: also consider the other subtask in our evaluation.
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space
page=0 xpos=4 ypos=9 left-column left-indent right-over indented-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numeric-only column-bottom

column2: We can distinguish between the SLU systems that
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column left-indent column-top headchar-capital

column2: work with the 1-best transcription and those that take
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: a representation of the n-best (Hakkani-Tür et al.,
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line itemization headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: 2006; Tur et al., 2002). The use of a word graph as
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line year

column2: the input of the SLU module makes this task more
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: difficult, as the search space becomes larger. On the
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: other hand, the advantage of using them is that there
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: is more information that could help to find the cor-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: rect semantic interpretation, rather than just taking
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the best sentence given by the ASR.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-line-space

column2: In the recent literature, a variety of approaches for
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital

column2: automatic SLU have been proposed, like those ex-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: plained in (Hahn et al., 2010; Raymond and Ric-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: cardi, 2007; McCallum et al., 2000; Macherey et
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower

column2: al., 2001; Léfèvre, 2007; Lafferty et al., 2001). The
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower

column2: methodology that we propose in this paper is based
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: on Stochastic Finite State Transducers (SFST). This
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: is a generative approach that composes several trans-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ducers containing acoustic, lexical and semantic
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: knowledge. Our method performs this composition
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: on-the-fly, obtaining as a result a concept graph,
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: where semantic information is associated with seg-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ments of words. To carry out this step, we use a
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: different language model for each concept and also
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: study the use of lexical categorization and lemmas.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: The best sequence of concepts can be determined by
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: finding the best path in the concept graph, with the
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: help of a language model of sequences of the con-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: cepts.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-line-space

column2: The rest of this paper is structured as follows. In
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital

column2: Section 2, the theoretical model for SLU based on
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-capital

column2: SFST is briefly presented. Then, in Section 3 the
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: methodology for converting word graphs into con-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: cept graphs is described. A experimentation to eval-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen column-bottom above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Proceedings of the 10th International Workshop on Finite State Methods and Natural Language Processing, pages 75–79,
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=9 single-column left-indent right-indent font-smallest column-top line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-comma

column2: Donostia–San Sebastián, July 23–25, 2012.  2012 c Association for Computational Linguistics
column3: page=0 xpos=1 ypos=9 single-column left-indent right-indent font-smallest indented-line shorter-tail year headchar-capital page-bottom

column2: uate this methodology for the SLU task is shown in
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified page-top headchar-lower

column2: Section 4. Finally, we draw some conclusions and
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: future work.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 2 The SFST approach for SLU
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: The Bayes classifier for the SLU problem can be ex-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: pressed as stated in equation 1, where C represents
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: a sequence of concepts or semantic labels and A is
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line itemization headchar-lower

column2: the utterance that constitutes the input to the system.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Ĉ = arg max p(C|A) (1)
column3: page=1 xpos=1 ypos=2 left-column left-indent indented-line line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: C
column3: page=1 xpos=2 ypos=2 left-column left-indent right-indent font-smallest indented-line shorter-tail headchar-capital above-line-space

column2: Taking into account the underlying sequence of
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column left-indent hanged-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital

column2: words W , and assuming that the acoustics may de-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: pend on W but not on C, this equation can be rewrit-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ten as follows.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column left-indent font-largest indented-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-capital above-double-space above-line-space

column2: To compute the best sequence of concepts Ĉ ex-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column left-indent hanged-line line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: pressed as in equation 2, the proposal made by the
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: paradigm based on SFST is to search the best path in
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: a transducer λ <sub>SLU</sub> result of composing four SFST:
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column right-indent font-larger aligned-line shorter-tail itemization headchar-lower tailchar-colon above-double-space above-line-space

column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column left-indent font-largest indented-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space

column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column left-indent font-larger hanged-line headchar-capital

column2: the ASR module where the acoustic probabilities
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: p(A|W ) are represented, λ <sub>gen</sub> introduces prior in-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified font-larger aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: formation of the task by means of a lexical cate-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: gorization, λ <sub>W</sub> 2C provides the probability of a se-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified font-larger aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: quence of words and labels it with a semantic label
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: 3 From word graphs to concept graphs
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: The output of an ASR can be represented as a word
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: graph. This word graph can be enriched with se-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: mantic information, obtaining a concept graph. This
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: concept graph constitutes a useful representation of
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the possible semantics, considering the uncertainty
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: expressed in the original word graph. Finally, find-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ing the best path in the concept graph using a lan-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: guage model of sequences of concepts provides as
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: a result the best sequence of concepts Ĉ, the recog-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line itemization headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: nized sentence W̃ , and its segmentation according
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: to Ĉ.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space
page=1 xpos=4 ypos=9 left-column left-indent right-over indented-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numeric-only column-bottom

column2: 3.1 Topology and semantics of the word graph
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column right-indent font-larger column-top numbered-heading2 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: To perform the transformations for obtaining the
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: concept graph, the input graph given by the ASR
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: should represent the information in the following
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: way. First, its nodes will be labeled with times-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tamps. Also, for every two nodes i, j such that
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: i < j − 1, there will be an edge from i to j labeled
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line itemization headchar-lower

column2: with w and weight s if the ASR detected w between
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the instants i and j − 1 with an acoustic score s.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Finally, there may exist a λ-transition between any
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: pair of adjacent nodes. The score of this edge should
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: be computed by means of a smoothing method.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-line-space

column2: Defining the word graph in this way allows us to
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital

column2: model on it the distribution p(A|w), where A is the
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: sequence of acoustic frames between the initial and
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: final nodes of any edge, and w the word attached to
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: it. This probability distribution is represented in the
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: theoretical model by λ <sub>G</sub> .
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column right-indent font-larger aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 3.2 Building the concept graph
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column right-indent font-larger aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading2 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: The concept graph that is obtained has the following
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: features. First, its set of nodes is the same of the
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: word graph, and its meaning is kept. There is at most
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: one edge between every two nodes i and j (i < j)
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: labeled with the concept c. Every edge is labeled
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: with a pair (W, c), where W is a sequence of words
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: and c the concept that they represent. The weight
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: of the edge is max <sub>W</sub> (p(A ji |W ) · p(W |c)), where A ji
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column centered right-indent font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: are the acoustic frames in the interval [i, j[ and W
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the argument that maximizes the former expression.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period above-line-space

column2: In this specification appears the probability distri-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column left-indent indented-line line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: bution p(W |c), which can be estimated by using a
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified font-largest hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: language model for each available concept.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-line-space

column2: This concept graph can be built using a Dynamic
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital

column2: Programming algorithm that finds for each concept
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-capital

column2: c and each pair of nodes i, j, with i < j, the
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line itemization headchar-lower

column2: path from i to j on the word graph that maximizes
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: p(A ji |W )·p(W |c). In this case, W is the sequence of
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: words obtained by concatenating the words attached
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: to the edges of the path. Each of the “best paths”
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: computed in this way will become an edge in the
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: resulting concept graph.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-line-space

column2: Thus, in the concept graph it is represented infor-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: mation about possible sequences of words that might
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: have been uttered by the speaker, along with the con-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: cepts each of these sequences expresses. This pair is
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: weighted with a score that is the result of combining
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower page-bottom

column2: the acoustic score expressed in the word graph, and
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified page-top headchar-lower

column2: the lexical and syntactic score given by the language
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: model, which is dependent on the current concept.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Furthermore, this information is enriched with tem-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: poral information, since the initial and final nodes
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: of every edge represent the beginning and ending
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: timestamps of the sequence of words. Consequently,
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: this way of building the concept graph corresponds
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: to the transducer λ <sub>W</sub> 2C of equation 3, since we find
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified font-larger aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: sequences of words and attach them to a concept.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: However, we also take advantage of and keep other
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: information, such as the temporal one.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 4 Experiments and results
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: To evaluate this methodology, we have performed
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: SLU experiments using the concept graphs obtained
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: as explained in Section 3 and then finding the best
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: path in each of them. For this experimentation we
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: have used the DIHANA corpus (Benedı́ et al., 2006).
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: This is a corpus of telephone spontaneous speech in
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: Spanish composed by 900 dialogs acquired by 225
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: speakers using the Wizard of Oz technique, with a
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: total of 6,229 user turns. All these dialogs simulate
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: real conversations in an automatic train information
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: phone service. The experiments reported here were
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: performed using the user turns of the dialogs, split-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ting them into a set of 1,340 utterances (turns) for
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: test and all the remaining 4,889 for training. Some
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: interesting statistics about the DIHANA corpus are
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: given in table 1.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: __Table 1__
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column right-over box aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space table-area above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Table 1: Characteristics of the DIHANA corpus.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column centered left-indent right-indent font-smallest indented-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space string-table headchar-capital tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: In the DIHANA corpus, the orthographic tran-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column left-indent hanged-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: scriptions of the utterances are semi-automatically
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: segmented and labeled in terms of semantic units.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: This segmentation is used by our methodology as a
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: language model of sequences of words for each con-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: cept. All the language models involved in this exper-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: imentation are bigram models trained using Witten-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: Bell smoothing and linear interpolation.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-capital tailchar-period

column2: In our experimentation, we have considered three
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: different ways for building the λ <sub>gen</sub> transducer ex-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified font-larger hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space
page=2 xpos=4 ypos=9 left-column left-indent right-over indented-line line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numeric-only column-bottom

column2: plained in Section 2. The first way consists of con-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified column-top headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: sidering a transducer that given a word as its input,
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: outputs that word with probability 1. This means
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: that no generalization is being done.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: The second λ <sub>gen</sub> transducer performs a lexical
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column left-indent font-larger indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: categorization of some of the nouns of the vocab-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ulary. Some extra words have been added to some
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: lexical categories, in order to make the task more
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: realistic, as the lexical coverage is increased. Never-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: theless, it also makes the task harder, as the size of
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the vocabulary increases. We have used a total of 11
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: lexical categories.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Finally, the third λ <sub>gen</sub> , transducer we have gen-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column left-indent font-larger indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: erated performs the same lexical categorization but
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: it also includes a lemmatization of the verbs. This
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: process is normally needed for real-world systems
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: that work with spontaneous (and maybe telephonic)
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: speech.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: We have generated three sets of word graphs to
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: take them as the input for the method. The first of
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: these sets, G <sub>1</sub> , is made up by the whole graphs ob-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified font-larger aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tained from a word graph builder module that works
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: without using any language model. The Oracle
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: WER of these graphs is 4.10. With Oracle WER we
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: mean the WER obtained considering the sequence of
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: words S(G) corresponding to the path in the graph
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: G that is the nearest to the reference sentence.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-capital tailchar-period

column2: The second set, G <sub>2</sub> , is composed by word graphs
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column left-indent font-larger indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: that only contain the path corresponding to S(G) for
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: each graph G ∈ G 1 . These graphs give an idea of
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the best results we could achieve if we could mini-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: mize the confusion due to misrecognized words.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: The third set, G <sub>3</sub> is formed by a synthetic word
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column left-indent font-larger indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: graph for each reference sentence, in which only that
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: sentence is contained. This set of graphs allows us
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: to simulate an experimentation on plain text.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: For our evaluation, we have taken two measures.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital tailchar-period

column2: First, we have evaluated the Concept Error Rate
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-capital

column2: (CER) over the best sequence of concepts. The def-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line tailchar-hiphen

column2: inition of the CER is analogous to that of the WER
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: but taking concepts instead of words. Second, we
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: have also evaluated the slot-level error (SLE). The
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: SLE is similar to the CER but deleting the non-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: relevant segments (such as courtesies) and substitut-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ing the relevant concepts by a canonic value for the
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: sequence of words associated to them.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Tables 2, 3, and 4 show the results obtained using
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail string-table headchar-capital

column2: the different λ <sub>gen</sub> transducers explained before.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column right-indent font-larger hanged-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period page-bottom

column2: __Table 2__
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=-2 left-column left-indent right-indent box page-top table-area above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Table 2: CER and SLE without any categorization.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column centered left-indent right-indent font-smallest hanged-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space string-table headchar-capital tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: __Table 3__
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column left-indent right-indent box indented-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space table-area above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Table 3: CER and SLE with lexical categorization.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column centered left-indent right-indent font-smallest hanged-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space string-table headchar-capital tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: From the results of Tables 2, 3, and 4 several facts
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column left-indent longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: come to light. First, we can see that, in all the exper-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: iments performed with the G <sub>1</sub> set, the CER is lower
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified font-larger aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: than the SLE, while with the other sets the CER is
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: larger than the SLE. It is due to the fact that the
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: whole graphs obtained from the word graph builder
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: have more lexical confusion than those from G <sub>2</sub> and
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified font-larger aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: G <sub>3</sub> , which are based on the reference sentence. This
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified font-larger aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: lexical confusion may cause that a well-recognized
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: concept is associated to a misrecognized sequence
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: of words. This would imply that a hit would be con-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: sidered for the CER calculation, while the value for
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: this slot is missed.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-line-space

column2: Other interesting fact is that, for the G <sub>1</sub> set, the
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column left-indent font-larger indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital

column2: more complex λ <sub>gen</sub> transducers give the worse re-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified font-larger hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: sults. This is because in these graphs there is a
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: significant confusion between phonetically similar
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: words, as the graphs were generated without any
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: language model. This phonetic confusion, combined
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: with the generalizations expressed by the lexical cat-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: egorization and the lemmas, makes the task harder,
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: which leads to worse results. Nevertheless, in a real-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: world application of this system these generaliza-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tions would be needed in order to have a larger cov-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: erage of the lexicon of the language. The experi-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ments on G <sub>2</sub> and G 3 show that when the confusion
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified font-larger aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: introduced in the graphs due to misrecognized words
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: is minimized, the use of lexical categorization and
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: lemmatization helps to improve the results.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 5 Conclusions and future work
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: In this paper we have described a methodology,
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-comma

column2: based on the SFST paradigm for SLU, for obtaining
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space
page=3 xpos=4 ypos=9 left-column left-indent right-over indented-line line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numeric-only column-bottom

column2: __Table 4__
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=-2 right-column left-indent right-indent box column-top table-area above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Table 4: CER and SLE with lemmatization and lexical
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified font-smallest hanged-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space string-table headchar-capital

column2: categorization.
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column right-indent font-smallest aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: concept graphs from word graphs. The edges of the
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-lower

column2: concept graphs represent information about possible
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: sequences of words that might have been uttered by
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the speaker, along with the concept each of these se-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: quences expresses. Each of these edges is weighted
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: with a score that combines acoustic, lexical, syntac-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tic and semantic information. Furthermore, this in-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: formation is enriched with temporal information, as
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the nodes represent the beginning and ending of the
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: sequence of words. These concepts graphs consti-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tute a very useful representation of the information
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: for SLU.
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-line-space

column2: To evaluate this methodology we have performed
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital

column2: an experimental evaluation in which different types
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: of lexical generalization have been considered. The
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: results show that a trade-off between the lexical con-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: fusion expressed in the word graphs and the general-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: izations encoded in the other transducers should be
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: achieved, in order to obtain the best results.
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-line-space

column2: It would be interesting to apply this methodology
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital

column2: to word graphs generated with a language model,
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: although this way of generating the graphs would
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: not fit exactly the theoretical model. If a language
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: model is used to generate the graphs, then their lex-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ical confusion could be reduced, so better results
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: could be achieved. Other interesting task in which
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: this methodology could help is in performing SLU
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: experiments on a combination of the output of some
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: different ASR engines. All these interesting appli-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: cations constitute a line of our future work.
